name: Great Grey Owl
description: A sturdy owl with strikingly long wings, a large head, a densely striped facial disc, and yellow irises.
spread_note: Northern regions of Eurasia and North America
food_note: Mammals up to hare size (mainly small rodents), occasionally other vertebrates and insects
image_alt: Great Grey Owl, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Length 61–84 cm; wingspan 135–152 cm; weight 0.75–1.45 kg
attractions: When hunting, it flies low over the ground or scans for prey from a tree or post. During nesting, the pair defends the nest, even driving off bears.
breeding: We’ve kept these large owls since 1987 and have bred them since 1995.
